meanings.definition: A person who holds strong and unorthodox opinions
meanings.sent1: Some people think he is a real cranks because of his unusual ideas.
meanings.sent2: The group of cranks at the meeting always had unique perspectives.
meanings.sent3: The town had a famous cranks who believed in talking to plants for good luck.
meanings.sent4: She stood out like a cranks in a sea of conformity with her radical thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The old man was known as the neighborhood cranks for his eccentric behavior.

meanings.definition: A device for transmitting motion or changing the direction of a force
meanings.sent1: The mechanic fixed the cranks in the engine to make it run smoothly.
meanings.sent2: The bicycle's cranks helped to turn the wheels efficiently.
meanings.sent3: The cranks in the clock were carefully adjusted to keep time accurately.
meanings.sent4: The cranks in the machine were essential for its operation.
meanings.sent5: He studied the cranks in the gearbox to understand their function.

meanings.definition: To turn a handle in order to start an engine
meanings.sent1: He cranks the engine to get the car started every morning.
meanings.sent2: She cranks the lawnmower to begin cutting the grass.
meanings.sent3: The old tractor cranks slowly but eventually starts up.
meanings.sent4: They had to crank the generator to power up the campsite.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic cranks the motor to test its functionality.
